name: Taj Mahal
description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra.

name: Hawa Mahal
description: Hawa Mahal, one of the best places to visit in Jaipur, features a splendid fusion of Islamic, Mughal, and Rajput architectural styles.

name: Agra Fort
description: Agra Fort is a historical fort in the city of Agra in India. It was the main residence of the emperors of the Mughal Dynasty till 1638, when the capital was shifted from Agra to Delhi.

name: Qutub Minar
description: Qutub Minar, also known as victory tower, is one of the tallest monuments in Asia and the tallest brick minaret in the world, at 72.5m.

name: Jama Masjid
description: An epitome of calmness and serenity amidst Delhiâ€™s hustle and bustle, Jama Masjid is a must-visit for those seeking spiritual bliss and historical enlightenment.

name: Red Fort
description: Constructed during the reign of Shah Jahan in the 17thcentury, Red Fort or Lal Qila is one of the most popular historical buildings of India.

name: Amer Fort
description: Built in the 16th century by Maharaja Man Singh, Amer Fort is one of the most ancient monuments in India.

name: City Palace
description: An enchanting blend of European, Medieval and Chinese architectural styles, City Palace is among the most popular tourist attractions in Udaipur.

name: Hawa Mahal
description: A prominent landmark in Jaipur, Hawa Mahal is an 18th century 5-storey building overlooking the busy streets of the city.

name: Gateway of India
description: This unique landmark is one of the most important monuments of India. It was constructed in the 20th century and has an Indo-Saracenic style of architecture.

name: Charminar
description: Built in the 16th century, this popular mosque is a brilliant combination of Indo-Islamic architecture and subtle Persian elements.

name: Brihadishwara Temple
description: .Also known as Periya Kovil, this ancient Hindu temple in Tamil Nadu is dedicated to Lord Shiva. This all-granite temple, depicting Dravidian architecture, is one of the largest temples in the country.

name: Mysore Palace
description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra.
